text: Hello again Ember friends.  I’m trying to create a hashbang for Google page indexing.  Would I do that in the config file or the router?
you may not need that at all
if your app has clear URLs for each page, there’s nothing else to do
back when this was first a problem, hashbang URLs were the solution. Not so much any more
Well the problem is that I’m using # now and Google isn’t reading anything after the hash
oh, I see. So you want to remove the hash, right?
I tried doing the location without using hash but it made my links from <http://shop.jkpike.com|shop.jkpike.com> not work
Well ideally yes
but like I said for some reason I couldn’t get it to work that way
book marking didn’t work
right. Of course. I remember your setup. You had this on your own server with Apache, right?
yes
what happens is: person arrives at `/our-products/wall-art` → Apache looks for that file → Doesn’t find it → 404 error
so Apache needs to be made aware that any URL needs to resolve to the base URL. `index.html` or whatever it is (I’m not sure)
yes that’s correct
then Ember will read it from `index.html` and figure out what to render
yes
the part of Apache that does this is called mod_rewrite (or was last time I checked). Let me see what the config would be there...
right, there appears to be a simpler way to do it nowadays, without mod_rewrite (which typically was a bit annoying)
apparently, you can add `FallbackResource /index.html` to your Apache config
do you know where that goes?
No that’s a little beyond my scope
depends on your setup. Check if there’s anything at `/etc/apache2`
if there is… there are several options
oh, some info here: <https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-configure-the-apache-web-server-on-an-ubuntu-or-debian-vps>

text: do you just use the default setting? You didn’t configure anything after install?
I just use default
cool. Then it’s probably adding the line to `/etc/apache2/apache.conf`, and then running `sudo service apache2 reload`
maybe better read the guide to know a bit better what you are doing
ok will do right now.  :slightly_smiling_face:
